description: The Nile River has been the heart of Egyptian life and culture for millennia. Ancient Egyptians traversed the Nile on boats of all shapes and sizes to conduct commerce, state business, and religious pilgrimages. Model boats like this example—equipped with oars, a mast, and a crew of 15—would have been placed in a tomb to provide the deceased with transportation in the afterlife.
title: Model of a River Boat
